description.narrative:
The support to the project Accelerating Trade in West Africa (ATWA) is aimed at advancing regional trade integration in West Africa. The regions¿ trade corridors are critical for economic and social development and as an example the Abidjan-Lagos corridor is one of the most used transport routes in West Africa. However, the region is suffering from major barriers and cost to trade and support to facilitating trade along the corridors is thus highly relevant to the region¿s development. The purpose of the present initial-stage support is to attain a robust political platform and comprehensive program to respond to the Abuja Process and recent momentum of developing cross-border trade and economic integration.
The long-term development of each of the West African economies hinges on the success of the regional integration agenda. With the possible exception of Nigeria, the individual economies are too small to compete effectively in international markets and their domestic markets are small to attract highly needed investments. To sustain higher growth, the economies need to expand, specialise and integrate to achieve economies of scale. This project aims at reducing regional and international trade costs which will benefit regional businesses, increase economic activities, growth and employment while private sector can benefit from access to larger markets, reduced transactions costs and better investment opportunities.
